turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: We are relying on the adult sentence, not on the Judge's statements that went with the sentence.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Do you rely on the Judge, the statement that the Youth Corrections Act is no longer in force?
Do you rely on that or not?

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: The Judge sentenced him to an adult sentence, found that he would not benefit from YCA treatment.
That is--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Do you rely on the Judge's statement?

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: --The Judge made a statement that the offender would--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Do you rely on it or not?

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: --We rely on his sentence, on the imposition of the adult sentence.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And what he said.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: In order to impose that sentence, he had to make a certain finding.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And you rely on that.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Well, we rely on the sentence which includes the finding, but it is the sentence we rely on, not his extra statements.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: I am a little puzzled.
The language you quoted was in 1975 or 1977?

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: So you say he did make the equivalent of a no benefit finding in 1975.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Yes, he made a no benefit finding explicitly.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: The 1977, there is no--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: In 1977 he did not do it.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: --There is none in the judgment and commitment order, but the Respondent concedes he is no raising that here, so for purposes of this case that has to be regarded as a valid adult sentence.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Can you tell me in 1975 what was the maximum sentence which the Trial Judge could have imposed for the crime he was found guilty of?

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Ten years.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: So if he had given a concurrent sentence of ten years--

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: --that would have solved the problem.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Well, not quite, I suppose because he had more than four and a half years left on his YCA sentence at that point.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Well, pretty close to solving it.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Pretty close to solving it.
Of course, that would have required the Judge to jiggle around his sentences in order to take care of the problem.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Well, the Bureau immediately treated him as an adult.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: And apparently said, ten years is enough.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: Ten years--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: As an adult.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: --Yes, the Bureau thought that his YCA sentence plus the consecutive sentence--

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: So it did not solve the problem.

turn.speaker: david_a_strauss
turn.label: Mr. David A. Strauss
turn.text: --Thank you.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you, gentlemen.
The case is submitted.
